decks.notes: The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly swarm the board with powerful creatures and deal damage to the opponent consistently. It utilizes cards like Voice of Victory and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to provide aggro pressure and finish off the opponent with cards like Goblin Bombardment and Galvanic Discharge. With a mix of efficient creatures, removal spells, and support cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Static Prison, the deck aims to control the battlefield and secure a fast victory in Modern 1 vs 1 matches.

This deck focuses on maximizing damage output and controlling the board through aggressive creature cards and removal spells. By utilizing Leylines and tribal effects, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly with powerful creatures like Ragavan, Scion of Draco, and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury. Stubborn Denial provides protection against removal spells, while Lightning Bolt and Tribal Flames serve as efficient removal options. The deck's mana base allows for flexibility and ensures smooth gameplay. Ultimately, the strategy is to establish early dominance and apply continuous pressure to secure victory.

The deck focuses on assembling a combo that can win the game without needing to use traditional lands. By using cards like Goblin Charbelcher and Lotus Bloom, the deck aims to quickly set up a powerful win condition while disrupting the opponent with counterspells and removal. The deck also includes cards like Flare of Denial and Thundertrap Trainer to protect its combo pieces and ensure that it can execute its game plan efficiently. Ultimately, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a powerful, landless combo strategy.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a combination of artifact creatures and cheap spells. By using cards like Mox Opal and Mishra's Bauble to generate mana and draw cards, the deck can play powerful threats like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student early in the game. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Pithing Needle and Repeal to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, the deck aims to be aggressive and efficient in order to win the game quickly.

This Mardu Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creature plays and direct damage spells to quickly overpower the opponent. It utilizes a combination of low-cost creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Goblin Bombardment, along with powerful finishers like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Sephiroth, Fabled SOLDIER. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Static Prison and Arena of Glory to control the battlefield. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Guide of Souls provide support and additional creature buffs to maintain pressure on the opponent. The deck aims to win the game swiftly through a mix of creature attacks and spell damage.

The deck focuses on utilizing spells and creatures to quickly assemble a powerful combo without relying on traditional land cards. By maximizing the use of cards like Beyeen Veil, Lotus Bloom, and Thundertrap Trainer, the deck aims to utilize powerful abilities and disrupt opponents' strategies with cards like Flare of Denial and Suppression Ray. The combination of control elements with combo potential makes this deck a versatile and unpredictable force to be reckoned with in Modern 1 vs 1 gameplay.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Emperor of Bones, then using Goryo's Vengeance and Tainted Indulgence to bring them back onto the battlefield for a quick win. Atraxa, Grand Unifier helps with card draw and control, while Psychic Frog and Fallaji Archaeologist provide additional graveyard manipulation. The deck also includes disruption with Force of Negation and Prismatic Ending to help protect the combo. The key strategy is to reanimate big threats at instant speed while controlling the board to secure victory.

This deck revolves around casting spells quickly and efficiently, utilizing cards like Ruby Medallion and Desperate Ritual to generate mana, while also using cards like Manamorphose and Ral, Monsoon Mage to dig for combo pieces. The goal is to storm off and generate a large amount of mana to cast a lethal Grapeshot or Past in Flames. Wish allows for toolbox options, while Reckless Impulse and Glimpse the Impossible help filter through the deck. The deck aims to win through a massive storm count and overwhelming the opponent with spells.
